text: - [Announcer] Yes sir!
Smirnoff Preparada!

Okay, so guess what you
could buy these at a
drive-through in Texas, okay?
They can't legally sell it to you,
okay with booze in it,
but they sell ya' Smirnoff Ice separate.
So that's Chamoy, Tajin.
We rim our glass, okay, gettin' all sexy.

Yeah it's a Mexican drink
but we put our American twist

on this, this more American
than it is Mexican right now.

So apple pieces, come
behind that with some

strawberry pieces, hit that
with some pineapple pieces.
Tons and tons of fruit, homeboy.
It's all good to go, okay?
Then we put some Chamoy in that bad boy,
let that flow down.
Chamoy's gon' add some flavoring, okay?

'Cuz it's kinda candy-like,
kinda sweet, kinda not.
Put in some more Tajin then we hit ours
with Green Apple Vodka.

Now typically, in Texas
and places like that,
they only use Smirnoff Ice, right?

But as tipsy bartender
we have to make sure
our stuff is potent enough.
If it's not potent enough we cannot do it.

Then we hit it wit' our
candies, we use rainbow belts.

Okay then we come behind
that with some Gummy Bears.

Then we come behind that
with some Sour Gummy Worms.

Then we come behind that, we
have a ton of candy in this,

okay just grab a handful
of candy, stick it on.
You don't need to know all the names, man.

Okay, then we put in a
gummy candy garnish, okay.

Wit' a cherry, and then
you have some more Chamoy,

and then you have it, homeboy,
the Smirnoff Preparada, okay.
Super fun, super tropic... is it tropical?
I don't know, super Mexican!
Stay tipsy, my friends, stay tipsy.
(uptempo jingle)
